Description: Rounded arsenical copper axe-head: with two lugs. The three binding-holes are misaligned. The piece is quite thickly corroded in parts, the line of the haft being clearly preserved. Remains of linen are also preserved in the corrosion product.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has shown that the axe, after initial working and annealing, was finally submitted to heavy cold working. A high hardness value was recorded for the cutting edge.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (55)
